intro: Metastelma cubense, commonly known as the Cuban spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance. The plant features slender stems and delicate, greenish-white flowers with a distinct, intricate structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
